text: <@U7V9DQ31P> so, simple! Does that express.js app run within the HubSpot CMS or is it hosted elsewhere?
it’s hosted elsewhere. If you have access to HubSpot enterprise you could probably put it inside a serverless function
Update endpoints will fail if there is no row already.. But create should succeed at least in your case. Did u see what is the response that you get back?

Hi there, I am working with a HubDB table and Dynamic Pages.  We have the pages generating exactly as we’d like them to, but we’d like to add the functionality to “Archive” a row in the table.  This is easy enough to do so that the page / record does not show in the query where we are showing the full data set, but I would assume that the Dynamic Page is still being created, served, and indexed by Google, etc.  I’d prefer to not have “archived” pages out there in the ether.  This functionality doesn’t seem possible from what I can find.  Any thoughts?
